On 20 October 2020, a reservist of the Philippine Army was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Bagong Silang, Caloocan (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The reservist was manning his store at the time of the attack and is assumed off-duty. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_1: Anakpawis; GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; KABATAAN: Kabataan Partylist; KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Pamalakaya: National Federation of Small Fisherfolk Organization in the Philippines; Farmers (Philippines); Fishermen (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines); Women (Philippines); Students (Philippines)
notes: On 21 October 2020, hundreds of demonstrators led by such groups as Anakpawis, GABRIELA, KABATAAN, KMP, KMU, Pamalakaya, as well as student groups staged a demonstration dubbed the 'National Day of Defiance' in Mendiola, Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), in order to mark National Peasant Month, to demand the repeal of the Rice Tariffication Law and the Anti-Terrorism Act, to condemn attacks against activists and the government's 'militarist' response to the coronavirus pandemic, and to call for the ouster of President Rodrigo Duterte. [size=hundreds]

On 21 October 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at his residence in Barangay Alegre (Oton, Iloilo, Western Visayas). Reports indicated that the slain suspect had previously surrendered for involvement in illegal drugs.

notes: On 21 October 2020, 250 alleged leaders of NPA 'mass organizations' surrendered to military, police and government officials and pledged loyalty to the government during a formal ceremony in Gingoog City (Misamis Oriental, Northern Mindanao).
On 22 October 2020, a barangay councilor was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Esperanza (Pilar, Sorsogon, Bicol Region). The motive for the attack was unclear.

Around 22 October 2020 (from 21-23 October), 793 drug suspects were arrested by the police in a three-day Simultaneous Anti-Criminality Law Enforcement Operation (SACLEO) across Central Visayas. Police said that among those arrested were high-value targets.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 23 October 2020, 2 soldiers and 2 active auxiliaries of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit were wounded in an explosion of a roadside IED suspected to have been planted by BIFF militants in Barangay Salman (Ampatuan, Maguindanao, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao).

assoc_actor_1: Refugees/IDPs (Philippines)
notes: On 24 October 2020, at least 51 families were evacuated to the barangay covered court in Barangay Arakan (Matalam, Cotabato, Soccsksargen) amid nearby fighting between the NPA and the military.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 24 October 2020, a suspected NPA militant was shot dead during a 20-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Arakan (Matalam, Cotabato, Soccsksargen). The military reported no casualties and also said that it retrieved weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 26 October 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Legaspi (Alegria, Cebu, Central Visayas). Authorities said that the slain suspect had previously been detained on drug charges.

On 26 October 2020, a drug suspect who had just escaped from jail was killed during a police raid in Barangay Luz, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). Police said that the slain suspect was in jail on drug and robbery charges.

Explosive remnants of war: On 26 October 2020, a civilian was killed while another was wounded when a vintage bomb left by unidentified actors during an earlier unidentified conflict exploded at a junkshop in Barangay San Isidro (Zaragoza, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon).

On 26 October 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 6, Tondo, Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). Police said that the slain suspect had been reported to authorities for using and dealing drugs.

Around 27 October 2020 (as reported), local residents staged a demonstration against SM Prime Holdings Inc.'s planned corporate takeover of the public market in Baguio (Benguet, Cordillera Administrative Region). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: HOOC: Hands Off Our Children; LPP: League of Parents of the Philippines; Liga Independencia Filipinas

[size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On 28 October 2020, a police officer allegedly raped a female detainee inside the municipal police station in San Miguel (Bulacan, Central Luzon). The woman was being held at the station for violating a COVID-19 curfew. The police officer was detained when the alleged rape came to light.
On 28 October 2020, a farmer was shot dead by suspected NPA militants inside his residence in Barangay Isca (Gonzaga, Cagayan, Cagayan Valley). The motive for the attack on the farmer was unclear.

assoc_actor_1: Anakpawis; GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Labour Group (Philippines); Women (Philippines)
notes: On 28 October 2020, demonstrators led by Anakpawis, GABRIELA and KMU staged a demonstration in front of the Armed Forces of the Philippines' headquarters in Camp Aguinaldo, Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), in order to denounce red-tagging and the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020. [size=no report]

On 28 October 2020, suspected Abu Sayyaf militants and the military engaged in a 20-minute firefight in Barangay Adjid, (Indanan, Sulu, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). The military said that there were no casualties on their side, while there was an undetermined number of wounded Abu Sayyaf militants. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items from the militants.

On 28 October 2020, an officer of the local Community Environment and Natural Resources Office was killed by unidentified assailants in Barangay Bunawan Brook (Bunawan, Agusan del Sur, Caraga). The officer and his team were carrying out an anti-timber poaching operation in the area when they were attacked by the assailants, suspected to be timber poachers.

On 28 October 2020, 2 drug and arms dealing suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Halayhayin (Pililla, Rizal, Calabarzon). Police said that they had been tipped of the illegal activities of the two suspects, which included drug- and arms-dealing, kidnapping and robbery.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Prison Guards
source: GMA News; ABS CBN; Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 29 October 2020, a drug suspect - also an active jail officer - was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bunggo, Calamba (Laguna, Calabarzon). Police said they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they reported to be a high-value target appearing on President Rodrigo Duterte's 'narco list' of prominent personalities allegedly connected to the drug trade. The jail officer is assumed to have been off-duty during the raid.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Philippine News Agency; GMA News; Sunstar (Philippines); CNN
notes: On 29 October 2020, an Abu Sayyaf militant was killed during a five-minute firefight between Abu Sayyaf militants and the military in Ungkaya Pukan (Basilan, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao) (Barangay Felang according to reports; this barangay cannot be located). The military reported no casualties and said they retrieved a weapon from the rebels.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On 29 October 2020, 2 civilians detained for purportedly violating coronavirus-related curfews were allegedly beaten by police officers who arrested them in Barangay Bula, General Santos (South Cotabato, Soccsksargen). They were also reportedly beaten under police custody at the police station.

On 29 October 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Antonino (Alicia, Isabela, Cagayan Valley). Police said that they retrieved illegal drugs from the slain suspect. His companion was also arrested.

assoc_actor_1: HOOC: Hands Off Our Children; LPP: League of Parents of the Philippines; Liga Independencia Filipinas
notes: On 29 October 2020, demonstrators led by such groups as Hands Off Our Children, League of Parents of the Philippines, and Liga Independencia Filipinas staged demonstrations against the Communist Party of the Philippines and the New People's Army at the University of the Philippines Diliman campus and at the Boy Scout Circle in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). [size=no report]

On 30 October 2020, a private security guard assigned to a school was shot dead, while a passerby was wounded, in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Basak San Nicolas, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). The security guard had just had dinner at a food stall and is assumed off-duty. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_1: LGBT (Philippines); Students (Philippines)
notes: On 30 October 2020, LGBTQ+ and student groups staged a Pride rally at the University of the Philippines Diliman campus in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The demonstrators called for the passage of the Anti-Discrimination Law and criticized Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's recent pardon of a US marine convicted of killing a Filipino transgender woman in 2014. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2020, the military retrieved and disposed of an IED planted by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants near a village road in Barangay Timbangan (Indanan, Sulu, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). The military said that the IED was going to be used by the Abu Sayyaf in an imminent bomb attack.

On 30 October 2020, 2 gunmen were killed in a firefight with police officers in Barangay San Antonio, Binan (Laguna, Calabarzon), after the police officers intercepted the gunmen and foiled what police said to be a planned attack on a local government official.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 31 October 2020, a former army reservist was shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Rosariohan (Batuan, Bohol, Central Visayas). The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 31 October 2020, 4 suspected NPA militants were killed during a 40-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Pangi, Tandag (Surigao del Sur, Caraga). The military reported no casualties and reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels. The military also said that they believed there were more NPA fatalities in addition to the 4 confirmed dead, and that there was also an undetermined number of wounded rebels.
